title: Death's Dance Bleed Effect Cancels Recall
body:
I cannot recall(lul) the exact instance when I first noticed this, but the bleed effect from Death's Dance interrupts the recall channel, even if the source of the bleed is from a minion/monster/non-champion. 

The reason I claim this as a "bug" is because I could not find any documentation of the re-implementation of this effect. But I specifically remember that **they had changed the bleed to NOT interrupt recalls**, at least if the bleed was from a minion/monster. 

I wanted to see if I was crazy or not, so I looked at the patch history for the item on Lolwiki
Patch 7.6, according to the source, _"Bleed effect now doesn't cancel Recall Recall."_
http://leagueoflegends.wikia.com/wiki/Death%27s_Dance
Unfortunately, the change is labeled to be "undocumented," which makes sense, because I checked the official patch 7.6, and didn't find anything on Death's Dance. 

Either way, there is no documentation on the Lolwiki about RIOT changing/reverting this after patch 7.6. So either the lolwiki is outdated/false - which is entirely plausible - or my memory is still intact after all.

So I'd like some confirmation, if anybody can find the specific instance where Riot changed Death's Dance bleed to stop/not stop recalls. That way it can be deduced whether this is a bug or not - or if I was making up stuff in my mind the whole time.

replies.body: It's possible something broke several patches later. Which usually sounds about right.

Agreed. But I would have thought somebody would have noticed it by now. Because "Several" seems quite literal in this case. I mean - it is such a small "bug" so I guess that's how it gets unnoticed. But it can really screw you up when you are backing after a baron take and you get caught in the pit because you can't back from the bleed haha.

Yeah... we refactor Recall a while back, that might have gotten lost in the refactor.
unfortunate........
So will you fix it or..?
I was wondering why last patch recall wasn't cancelled and this patch it is lol
